From: IT_Security@company.com
To: All_Users
Subject: Important Security Update - Please Read

Dear Employees,

We are conducting a mandatory security audit across the organization to ensure all systems remain secure and protected from potential threats. As part of this process, we will be sending out test phishing emails to selected users over the next few days. These emails will mimic legitimate company communications and may contain links or attachments that appear to come from known sources.

It is crucial that you do not click on any suspicious links or open attachments within these emails. Instead, please follow the steps below:

1. Report the email as phishing by forwarding it to phish_catcher@company.com
2. Ignore and delete the email from your inbox
3. Follow up with IT Security if you have any concerns or believe you may have accidentally clicked on a link or opened an attachment

Thank you for your cooperation during this security audit. Your vigilance helps protect our company's sensitive data and systems.

Best regards,
IT_Security Team

From: it_security@company.com
To: Jane Doe
Subject: Mandatory IT Security Checks This Week

Dear Jane,

We are conducting mandatory security checks across the organization this week to ensure all systems remain safe and secure. To assist you in this process, we kindly ask that you run the following command on your workstation before Friday:

'wmic /node:localhost /user:"domain\username" /password:"your_password" csproduct get name'

This command will help us verify if all necessary security patches and updates have been applied to your system. Please follow any instructions that may appear after running the command.

Thank you for your cooperation in maintaining a secure work environment.

Best regards,
IT Security Team

4. Hide the extracted Payload naturally inside this new Carrier.
